messages.message:
Current supported versions should be
• 25.30
• 25.28
• 25.26
Doesn't necessarily mean that all backports to 25.30 are applicable to 25.26 though - in fact, backports should  be almost nonexistent to the oldest AIHub release.

We came across a situation where we had to do an emergency maintenance to one of our customers axa to pick up a bug fix.
While the specific bug fix was verified for backport it was unclear if other backports are safe to ignore.
This coupled with the fact that we only verify upgrades for latest aihub in aihub.preprod raised some questions.

We were successfully able to finish the emrgency maintenance but wanted to start this discussion to see if these is clarity on how many versions to backport.
we should backport to all supported version
i'd love to understand why we shouldn't be backporting to our supported versions

Yash pointed out that not all changes are relevant to all AIHub versions - ref (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CGQ7BD72A/p1754013892586079?thread_ts=1753956590.919949&cid=CGQ7BD72A)

I would feel better if its consistent, either backports go to all supported versions or none at all.
These releases are just 2 weeks apart so the versions should hardly have any incompatibility.
For. eg.: In this weeks case should we by default backport to 25.26 till 25.30 is deployed ? or when do we stop backporting to 25.26

Simply because not every release has a bug that needs to be fixed :)

Consider this:

Supported releases: N-2, N-1, N

Bug found in N-1

Bug fix needs to be merged to master and backported to N and N-1 only.
